member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.StateBase

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.RegistryState.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RegistryState class, using an existing RegistryState object that has the Application Launcher enabled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.RegistryState.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the RegistryState class, using persisted (saved) state values of a previous instance. This persisted RegistryState object is uniquely identified by the applicationLaunchId.
member.remarks: Use the application’s form thread if you want to manipulate the user interface using an event.
member.param: The unique ID of the RegistryState to load.
A value indicating whether to use the application's form thread for event processing. If your application does not contain a form, then set this value to false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.RegistryState.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RegistryState class, using the key name, the names of its values.
member.param: The string value of the registry key.
The string name of the value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.RegistryState.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RegistryState class, using the key name, the names of its values, and a value indicating whether to use the application’s form thread to process the events.
member.remarks: Use the application’s form thread if you want to manipulate the user interface using an event.
member.param: The string value of the registry key.
The string name of the value.
A value indicating whether to use the application's form thread for event processing. If your application does not contain a form, then set this value to false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.RegistryState.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes a RegistryState.
member.remarks: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources. Disables finalization by the garbage collector by a calling GC.SuppressFinalize(this).

member.summary:

When your app is launched, "/notify 'applicationLaunchId'" (no quotes) will be passed on the command line.
member.param: id of the SystemState to enable

arguments to pass to the application

member.summary: Specifies the types of comparison operations used in status events.

member.summary: Any state change. This is the default value.

member.summary: The state values are equal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.StatusComparisonType.NotEqual

member.summary: The comparison value is greater than the state value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.StatusComparisonType.GreaterOrEqual
member.summary: The comparison value is greater than or equal to the state value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.StatusComparisonType.Less
member.summary: The comparison value is less than the state value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.StatusComparisonType.LessOrEqual
member.summary: The comparison value is less than or equal to the state value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.StatusComparisonType.Contains

member.summary: The state value begins with the comparison value (strings only).

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.StatusComparisonType.EndsWith
member.summary: The state value ends with the comparison value (strings only).

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.Status.ChangeEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the Change event.
member.remarks: When you create a ChangeEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate.
